title: Hilton expands hotel pipeline into Melbourne's northern suburbs
text:
"We are deeply committed to the Melbourne market and expanding Hilton’s presence beyond our existing DoubleTree by Hilton Melbourne – Flinders Street," said Heidi Kunkel, vice-president of Australasia operations at Hilton.

"The signing of Hilton Garden Inn Bundoora, along with the newly signed Hilton Melbourne Little Queen Street and Hilton Melbourne Square properties, further solidifies this commitment," Ms Kunkel said.

Melbourne expansion

Hilton currently operates 27 hotels in the region, but has little exposure to the Melbourne market after its two flagship hotels were taken over by new operators and owners.

Its 396-room Hilton Melbourne South Wharf was in 2017 rebranded as the Pan Pacific Melbourne, while in 2015 the 419-room Hilton on the Park near the Melbourne Cricket Ground was rebranded as Pullman Melbourne on the Park, operated by Accor.

The new Bundoora hotel will sit within a 10.5-hectare master-planned Dealcorp development incorporating parklands, a modern dining and retail precinct and low-rise residential space.

Alongside its 168 rooms, Hilton Garden Inn Bundoora will include an all-day dining restaurant and bar, a fitness centre and 127 sq m of event space.

Advertisement

Mr Kobritz said he was glad to be able to bring the Hilton brand to Melbourne’s north.

"The hotel will serve the adjoining La Trobe University and the growing corporate and residential markets in the north," he said.

Hilton is also expanding in Sydney with a 245-room hotel due to open in Parramatta in 2022.

The new hotel will replace the former AMP building at 20 Macquarie Street – once the tallest building in Parramatta – which will be demolished with construction of a 90-metre building to kick off in 2020.

Another luxury hotel is planned for Canberra.
description: Hilton Garden Inn Bundoora will form part of Dealcorp's $500 million Polaris 3083 development north of Melbourne.
